holidays.name: National Red Wine Day
holidays.description: A day for wine lovers to savor and celebrate the rich flavors of red wine from around the world.
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday created to honor one of the most popular and ancient types of wine.
holidays.funFact: The oldest known red wine dates back over 7,000 years and was found in Georgia (the country).

holidays.name: Race Your Mouse Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration encouraging people to challenge friends or coworkers to a 'race' using their computer mice.
holidays.origin: An unofficial internet holiday born from office humor and gaming culture.
holidays.funFact: This day is often used to break the monotony of work with quick, silly competitions involving mice and cursor skills.

holidays.name: National Bow Tie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the fashion-forward accessory that turns ordinary outfits into classy statements!
holidays.origin: Unofficial style day appreciating the classic bow tie, often associated with quirky fashion and distinguished personalities.
holidays.funFact: Winston Churchill and Albert Einstein were famous bow tie aficionados.

holidays.name: Universal Chopsticks Day
holidays.description: Honoring the iconic eating utensils that have been used for thousands of years, encouraging everyone to try chopsticks for a meal!
holidays.origin: An unofficial cultural homage day acknowledging chopsticks' impact globally.
holidays.funFact: Chopsticks have been used in China for over 5,000 years and are the most popular eating utensil in the world.
